titleStmt.title: Englands petition, to her gratious King, that he Arminius, would to ruine bring, who, by his doctrine, priuie plotts, and hate to verity, doth ruine church and state.
Great king protect us with thy gratious hand.
Englands petition, to her gratious King, that he Arminius, would to ruine bring, who, by his doctrine, priuie plotts, and hate to verity, doth ruine church and state.
Great king protect us with thy gratious hand.

notesStmt.note: A petition to King Charles I against the doctrines of Arminius.
A previous edition, dated 1628, has verses in letterpress and lacks caption. Text begins: Great king protect us with thy gratious hand.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
